dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, uh, you know how Apple's always been kind of quietly trying to, like, build its own search stuff? Big news this week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, uh, you know how Apple's always been kind of quietly trying to, like, build its own search stuff? Big news this week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah? What's up? Are they finally, like, launching something big?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah? What's up? Are they finally, like, launching something big?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, actually, it's the opposite! According to The Wall Street Journal, they're basically, um, giving up on competing with Google in search.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, actually, it's the opposite! According to The Wall Street Journal, they're basically, um, giving up on competing with Google in search.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple is intensifying long-standing efforts to beat Google at its own game by building its own rival search engine technology, the Financial Times report...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Wait, what? Seriously? I thought they were, like, secretly working on a Google killer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? Seriously? I thought they were, like, secretly working on a Google killer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? But no, it seems they're actually strengthening their partnership. And get this, they've really diminished their own search capabilities in iOS 14.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? But no, it seems they're actually strengthening their partnership. And get this, they've really diminished their own search capabilities in i O S fourteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the latest version of the iPhone operating system, iOS 14, Apple bolstered its own search capabilities with little fanfare, the Financial Times reports.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, if you type something into the spotlight search, it's all Google now? Even more than before?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, if you type something into the spotlight search, it's all Google now? Even more than before?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. They've removed Apple's own search results, and it's exclusively Google-powered now. It went, uh, largely unnoticed, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. They've removed Apple's own search results, and it's exclusively Google-powered now. It went, uh, largely unnoticed, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The change went largely unnoticed, and included displaying its own search results and linking to websites directly rather than through another engine when users typed queries from their home screens.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And I guess Google's still paying them, what, like, eight to twelve billion a year to be the default?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And I guess Google's still paying them, what, like, eight to twelve billion a year to be the default?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the iPhones default search engine Google, who pay $8-12 billion a year for the privilege in a deal U.S. antitrust regulators are investigating remains unchanged...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that hasn't changed. But the WSJ is calling this a "strategic retreat" for Apple, not an advance. They're basically saying Apple's just not interested in challenging Google anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that hasn't changed. But the W S J is calling this a strategic retreat for Apple, not an advance. They're basically saying Apple's just not interested in challenging Google anymore.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the FT says the change is an important advance that could form the foundation of a fuller attack on Google, according to several people in the industry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But that's so weird because I feel like I've heard about them, you know, hiring search engineers and stuff. Like, building internal projects.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But that's so weird because I feel like I've heard about them, you know, hiring search engineers and stuff. Like, building internal projects.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the FT points to growing evidence that the iPhone maker is attempting to build its own search engine, including poaching Googles head of search, ambitious hiring for search engineers...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They are! But then the WSJ also points out they're actively dismantling their web crawler, which is, uh, how they catalogue online material. So it's a bit of a mixed message there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They are! But then the W S J also points out they're actively dismantling their web crawler, which is, uh, how they catalogue online material. So it's a bit of a mixed message there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and increased activity from Apples web crawler, which could be used to catalogue online material.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That is confusing. So, what do the antitrust folks think about all this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That is confusing. So, what do the antitrust folks think about all this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the US regulators investigating these deals are apparently satisfied with this arrangement. Which is interesting, given all the antitrust noise around big tech.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the U S regulators investigating these deals are apparently satisfied with this arrangement. Which is interesting, given all the antitrust noise around big tech.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. Department of Justice sued Google last week for alleged antitrust violations following a 16-month investigation into the practices of big tech companies. The investigation included its multi-billion deal with Apple to ensure Google remains the default search engine on the iPhone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, I remember that DOJ investigation into whether Apple was letting Google be default. It actually, um, concluded pretty quickly, didn't it? Like, in a week? They didn't sue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, I remember that D O J investigation into whether Apple was letting Google be default. It actually, um, concluded pretty quickly, didn't it? Like, in a week? They didn't sue.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. Department of Justice sued Google last week for alleged antitrust violations following a 16-month investigation into the practices of big tech companies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, that specific one. But here's the wild part: Epic Games, who obviously had that huge battle with Apple over Fortnite... they're actually backing Apple in *this* instance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, that specific one. But here's the wild part: Epic Games, who obviously had that huge battle with Apple over Fortnite... they're actually backing Apple in this instance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Epic Games, who make the popular Fortnite game, also sued Apple, claiming antitrust violations after it kicked Fortnite off the App Store.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, Epic Games? Really? The ones who got kicked off the App Store?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, Epic Games? Really? The ones who got kicked off the App Store?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah! They're praising Apple's embrace of Google's services, calling it a "new era of collaboration." I mean, who saw that coming?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah! They're praising Apple's embrace of Google's services, calling it a new era of collaboration. I mean, who saw that coming?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Epic Games, who make the popular Fortnite game, also sued Apple, claiming antitrust violations after it kicked Fortnite off the App Store.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That is... wild. So, it's like Apple and Google are becoming more intertwined, not less. And everyone's kinda okay with it, it seems?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That is... wild. So, it's like Apple and Google are becoming more intertwined, not less. And everyone's kinda okay with it, it seems?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For now, yeah. And speaking of Google, totally unrelated, but did you know they're building a cell network on the Moon?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For now, yeah. And speaking of Google, totally unrelated, but did you know they're building a cell network on the Moon?

dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Okay, that *is* unrelated, but also amazing. Just, uh, casual Moon projects for Google, I guess.
